Title: A Short Poem
Text:
Gryphon's Fortress, Gryphon's Fortress, I feel thee near,
In winds that stir the banners gold, their song I hear.
The shining banners lift and dance, and sing of battles won,
Across the ink-dark tides, through rivers red as blood, and me on the ground.
With them comes the golden triumph, and my mother's call,
With banners high, let winds arise, and bear me far from all.

Gryphon's Fortress, Gryphon's Fortress, I clasp thee tight,
From waters deep, from the lake asleep in the hush of night,
From the streams that flowed through my mother's braids
From the blood-stained water dripping from my brother's blade,
Those waters rise to meet me now, and they will stay, your steadfast aid.

Gryphon's Fortress, Gryphon's Fortress, I will shield thee well,
With lake and sea and blood of mine, a sacred, binding spell.
The dark tides shall never touch thy breast,
The dark tides shall never wash over my mother's hair,
The dark tides shall never bring thy end!
Gryphon's Fortress, O Gryphon's Fortress, in the unsetting sun you gleam,
Forever kissed by whispering breeze, like an eternal dream.
